  proposition: Grgur Kovač, Rémy Portelas, Masataka Sawayama, Peter Ford Dominey, and Pierre-Yves Oudeyer studied stability of personal values in large language models.

    Grgur Kovač|RESEARCHED|stability of personal values

  proposition: The study was published in Plos one journal in 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Plos one|PUBLISHED|study on stability of personal values
    Plos one|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024

  proposition: Joon Sung Park and colleagues explored generative agents as interactive simulacra of human behavior.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Joon Sung Park|RESEARCHED|generative agents
    Joon Sung Park|EXPLORED|interactive simulacra of human behavior

  proposition: Yue Huang and researchers investigated the reliability of large language models in social simulations.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yue Huang|RESEARCHED|reliability of large language models
    Yue Huang|INVESTIGATED|social simulations

  proposition: Alapan Kuila and Sudeshna Sarkar examined political entity sentiment in news using large language models with zero-shot and few-shot strategies.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Alapan Kuila|RESEARCHED|political entity sentiment
    Sudeshna Sarkar|RESEARCHED|political entity sentiment
    Alapan Kuila|USED|large language models
    Sudeshna Sarkar|USED|large language models

topic: Large Language Models in Political Analysis

  entities:
    Hazem Ibrahim|Researcher
    Chenxiao Yu|Researcher
    Twitter|Platform

  proposition: Hazem Ibrahim and colleagues analyzed political stances on Twitter leading up to the 2024 US election.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Hazem Ibrahim|RESEARCHED|political stances
    Hazem Ibrahim|ANALYZED|Twitter data

    entity-entity relationships:
    Hazem Ibrahim|RESEARCHED|2024 US election

  proposition: Chenxiao Yu and researchers conducted a large-scale empirical study on large language models for election prediction.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Chenxiao Yu|CONDUCTED|large-scale empirical study
    Chenxiao Yu|RESEARCHED|election prediction

topic: Large Language Models in Legal Domain

  entities:
    Drew Simshaw|Researcher

    LegalBench|Toolkit
    Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems|Journal

    Duke Law & Technology Review|Journal

    Dietrich Trautmann|Researcher

  proposition: Drew Simshaw explored access to AI justice and potential inequities in legal services.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Drew Simshaw|RESEARCHED|AI justice
    Drew Simshaw|EXPLORED|inequities in legal services

  proposition: Tshilidzi Marwala and Letlhokwa George Mpedi discussed artificial intelligence and access to justice in a book chapter published by Springer in 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Tshilidzi Marwala|DISCUSSED|artificial intelligence
    Letlhokwa George Mpedi|DISCUSSED|access to justice
    Springer|PUBLISHED|book chapter
    Springer|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024

  proposition: Haitao Li and colleagues developed LegalAgentBench for evaluating LLM agents in the legal domain.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Haitao Li|DEVELOPED|LegalAgentBench
    LegalAgentBench|PURPOSE|evaluating LLM agents in legal domain

  proposition: Matthew Dahl and colleagues profiled legal hallucinations in large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Matthew Dahl|RESEARCHED|legal hallucinations
    Matthew Dahl|PROFILED|large language models

  proposition: Varun Magesh and researchers assessed the reliability of AI legal research tools.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Varun Magesh|ASSESSED|reliability of AI legal research tools

  proposition: Neel Guha and colleagues created LegalBench, a collaborative benchmark for measuring legal reasoning in large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Neel Guha|CREATED|LegalBench
    LegalBench|PURPOSE|measuring legal reasoning in large language models

  proposition: Maura R Grossman and colleagues explored justice in a generative AI world.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Maura R Grossman|EXPLORED|justice in generative AI world

  proposition: Abe Bohan Hou and researchers examined gaps or hallucinations in machine-generated legal analysis.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Abe Bohan Hou|EXAMINED|gaps in machine-generated legal analysis
    Abe Bohan Hou|EXAMINED|hallucinations in machine-generated legal analysis

  proposition: Dietrich Trautmann and colleagues investigated measuring the groundedness of legal question-answering systems.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Dietrich Trautmann|INVESTIGATED|groundedness of legal question-answering systems
